title: 106_s590
content: The Act titled "Elimination of Double Subsidies for the Hardrock Mining Industry Act of 1999" repeals the percentage depletion allowance for certain hardrock mines. SEC. 2 of the Act repeals the percentage depletion allowance for certain hardrock mines located on specific lands. It defines "general mining laws" and specifies the effective date for the amendments. SEC. 3 introduces the Abandoned Mine Reclamation Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund is established in the Treasury, funded by appropriations and credits. 25 percent of additional revenues go to the Trust Fund. The Secretary of the Interior can use Trust Fund amounts for land reclamation and restoration. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund in the Treasury is funded by appropriations and credits. Trust Fund amounts can be used for reclamation and restoration of lands and water resources affected by mineral mining, including reclamation of abandoned mine areas, prevention of water pollution, and erosion control. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund is used for reclamation of lands affected by mineral mining, including abandoned mine areas, water pollution prevention, and erosion control. Lands and water resources subject to mining laws and affected by mining activities are eligible for reclamation under this section. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund is used for reclamation of lands affected by mineral mining, including abandoned mine areas, water pollution prevention, and erosion control. Lands and water resources subject to mining laws and affected by mining activities are eligible for reclamation under this section, excluding sites and areas designated for certain purposes. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund is used for reclamation of lands affected by mineral mining, excluding sites designated for specific remedial actions under certain Acts. The term 'general mining laws' refers to specific Acts in the United States Code. A conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Abandoned Mine Reclamation Trust Fund is utilized for reclaiming lands impacted by mineral mining, excluding sites designated for specific remedial actions under certain Acts. A conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
